definition: confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
vertigo/dizziness/fainting/feeling of swaying, head spinning, lack of balance or floating (e.g. from a stroke)/Taiwan pr. [xuan4 yun1]
to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed

sentences.english: I still faint when seeing the flower field planting Lavender.
sentences.chinese: 看到種薰衣草的花田，我還是暈。

sentences.english: Do not swim in the water.
sentences.chinese: 暈，不在水裏遊，在什麼地方？

sentences.english: The "stunned" zombie is not allowed totag a human for a predetermined length of time.
sentences.chinese: 暈匭馴的殭屍在預訂時間內不能再傳染人類。

sentences.english: Yes, but I also feel dizzy.
Scientists have identified a condition called 'cybersickness', which they say is the digital version of motion sickness.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們認爲，‘暈屏幕’病是電子版的暈動病。

sentences.english: The model of primary superimposed halo in the deposit has been established.
sentences.chinese: 據上述特點建立了礦牀的原生疊加暈模式。

sentences.english: Dry ginger root powder has marked anti-sea-sickness effect which is stronger than dimenhydrinate .
sentences.chinese: 乾薑粉具有明顯的抗暈船作用，其效果強於暈海寧。

sentences.english: His head seemed to go round, and he clutched at the nearest passerby.
sentences.chinese: 他感到頭有些暈，便抓住離他最近的過路人。

sentences.english: Your tired notions of "the market" make our eyes glaze over.
sentences.chinese: 你們令人厭倦的“市場”觀念讓我們耳眩目暈。

sentences.english: It is only to be used at the longest telephoto setting of the camera in order to avoid vignetting.
sentences.chinese: 只有將在最長的長焦相機的設置使用，以避免暈。

sentences.english: Jet halo is a kind of geochemical secondary halo.
sentences.chinese: 射流暈是一種地球化學次生暈。

definition: to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
(posing a question: whether sb, something) can or cannot?/is able to or not
to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
